FuncDef:
The location slot command configures information about the CPU or the master or slave main control board in a simplified NAT instance so that the instance is bound to the CPU.
The undo location slot command deletes information about the CPU or the master or slave main control board in a simplified NAT instance.
By default, no information about the CPU or the master or slave main control board is configured in a simplified NAT instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of the slave main control board.
-

Specifies the slot ID of the master main control board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the nat instance command is run to create a simplified NAT instance, a device automatically generates a service-instance-group service instance group named _default_ and binds it to the NAT instance. Then the location slot command is run in the NAT instance so that the device automatically generates a service-location backup group and binds it to the instance group named _default_. Consequently, NAT configuration is simplified by eliminating manual configurations.
The location slot command is only used to direct traffic to a service board.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The location slot command takes effect only on the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S.
